title: Famous Stories Every Child Should Know
author: Various
snippet: It was less than three hours sincehe left, and he must have posted out--who knows how?--to Howgate, fullnine miles off; yoked Jess, and driven her astonished into town.

title: Famous Stories Every Child Should Know
author: Various
snippet: Jess, the mare, had been sent, with her weather-worn cart, to Howgate,and had doubtless her own dim and placid meditations and confusions,on the absence of her master and Rab, and her unnatural freedom fromthe road and her cart.

title: Rab and His Friends and Other Papers
author: Brown, John
snippet: Ailie, the day or two after the operation, when she was well and cheery, spoke about him, and said she would tell me fine stories when I came out, as I promised to do, to see her at Howgate.

title: The book of friendship;
snippet: It was less than three hours since he left, and he must have posted out — who knows how ? — to Howgate, full nine miles off ; yoked Jess, and driven her astonished into town.

title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: I remember one November afternoon, toward the close of the day, I went out to tiy the Howgate,  and pulling on a large fly (for I prefer such, with a good deal of the golden pheasants feathers for evening), at the second or third cast I had him fast, and felt him pretty heavy, he went off nobly down the stream, and out went the line in a whir.

title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: is Howgate, at Thornilee, in the parish of Innerleithen,  and county of Selkirk.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: The onlypublic conveyance at that time between Peebles andEdinburgh was a caravan which went by Howgate.
